text: The first few seconds sound like the studio recording of "True Love Waits" by Radiohead off of A Moon Shaped Pool. Not a bad comparison. Great track, this.
author: CRS

text: Hotline miami 2, FTL, you're definitely in a sad or melancholic mood in this july month.
author: Un autre que moi

text: It's too to be sad, SD! You make everyone happy posting these. This song..reminds me of hot, sweltering summer days, and hotter nights. The stuff of gritty, violence pulp movies.
author: Tommy Efreeti

text: Hey, Supra. What are your impressions of 'A Nearly Peaceful Place' from The Witcher 2 soundtrack?

text: That's one of my favorites ever

text: One of my fave track from the game.
author: Bosca

text: Yes ! My favourite one in the soundtrack ! :D
author: Francis Rave

text: Melancholy right there. I feel like this is the kind of music I'd hear as someone sits in front of the sunset, thinking. It actually reminds me a bit of some of the music in Welcome to the NHK (before the beat kicks in). The varied soundtracks are definitely a big reason why I enjoy the games so much, though I did feel like Hotline Miami 2 could have been something much more special after the first game's success.
author: SupraDarky

text: I'm intrigued by your take on Hotline 2 Supra. What didn't you like about it? I recently played both in succession and I thought 2 perfectly matched up to the standards set by 1, and even surpassed them in some regards. What did you feel it lacked?
